comments.comment: Every single video with Ken it always starts with Felix asking a question to Ken then he answers with a 100% honest answer in the most confused sounding way.
Ken and Felix is the ideal duo. When they film together their IQ drops by 70% for each one and its soo entertaining.
Love how Ken's first reaction when seeing someone with a gun is "shoot him", truly a certified American moment

11:37 the tree was struck by lightning, and that ignited the wood inside. Now it has a nice warm place to burn. These actually happen more often than you might think. It's a lot like the pits of burning ash people sometimes step in years after a forest fire(yes, it's still hot enough to cause burns, third degree often times).
Little did I know we now have to protect Felix from himself when it comes to lightsabers
These two are so compatible. Great screen chemistry and an authentic good time.
This kind of videos always are 95% Felix and Ken just telling random storytimes about the 5% of the things they review. And I love it
3:12 pewds "So far I'm not impressed" literally 7 seconds later ""
Pewdiepie and Ken are such nice friends its so enjoyable watching them just talking and chilling
Wow what a bunch of nice people in the comments section

These collabs always make my day 
Felix “I feel like I could make an invisibility cloak” 
Ken “why do you think you could do that?”

These videos give me so much comfort and make me so happy. Times like right now when things aren't great these guys make me feel safe and welcome. Their banter and the way they interact is so genuine and wholesome. Even for normal entertainment they are something to look forward to every time a new one comes out. I've rewatched all of the videos of them together but, this time I just wanted to say thank you. To the both of you so much.
i love ken and felix together, it’s like uncle and nephew
The real magic is the Dad-and-son chemistry between these two, lol.
I wonder if people in the Medieval Ages thought their sleep paralysis demons were summoned by black magic
The blue waves in the first video are actually from shrimp. Happens here in Florida about once a year or once every other year - it’s surprisingly bright in person and makes crab hunting a lot easier

idk when it happened but it's interesting to notice that once upon a time everyone in the comments called Felix 'Pewdiepie' or 'Pewds' and now majority just call him 'Felix'. feels very wholesome, like a genuine closeness has developed over time.
I love that Ken and Felix are in the same or similar time zones now, more collabs between them are an awesome treat!

The cloud on top the mountain is called a lenticular cloud, they're VERY common.
It's when the moist air, being forced up the mountain by the wind, turns into vapour before being warmer on the other side of the mountain :)

A little context for the bioluminescence— its actually in a lot of the plankton in certain areas certain times of the year— but there’s other animals that can carry it— but some places like in the clip its so concentrated the water itself glows
I was listening to this video on full blast, and the "can i talk" voice at 15:40 almost scared the shit out of me

I recently took my kayak out into the bioluminescent plankton. It was a rainy night, I debated not going. But it was even better. With each rain drop, a ring of bioluminescence would ripple as it hit. I saw three dolphins that glowed as they moved, as well as many fish and even a manatee that went under my kayak and nearly knocked me out. I enjoyed putting my hands in the water and splashing to make it glow. When I took my hands out they still had glowing and flickering specks on them for a few seconds. It truly was a magical experience

The arrow s-curve is actually an ancient technique, no magnets. A Danish archer  fully mastered it, as well as other ancient archery techniques like firing 2 arrows per second but still hitting right on the target. His name is Lars Andersen. He was the action consultant for Robin Hood movie remake starring Taron Egerton.
You know Ken is really experiencing Aussie culture after saying "ahh I've busted my pluggers"
Man I was just sitting here with anxiety and you guys just made it go away. Another hilarious Ken and Pewds collaboration

Pewdiepie : Do you believe in magic?
Ken : No
Roll credits XD

11:50 this is an actual thing I learned in wildland firefighting. The trees roots are connected so if there’s a forest fire the fire will actually travel through the roots of the tree and into the tree itself.
I absolutely love these videos with ken, y’all so hilarious together!
It's so calming to watch two old man just chatting.
I Love how Pewds and Ken has been friends for a long time ever since his YouTube career started they've always bond with each other
6:00 it’s called a lenticular cloud, named after it’s bean shape. Had to learn that to get my license to fly drones in public airspace =)
8:00 Whoever placed those bottles there is the god of bottle-flip challenges.
Ken and pewds are the one of the most iconic duo on YouTube
It feels so nice that this friendship lasted through the years, i still remember them playing Prop Hunt and laughing so hard...
The real magic is how Felix makes our days better right away with just one video
These two are real friends and you can tell they both absolutely love the time they share together.
I really like that at 10:57, Felix's reaction to the trick is that he wants to try it himself and Ken's reaction that his kids would crazy for it, that sums it up really nice
Im an archer, & I can say that the s curve takes someone extremely skilled to do. (Unless you use a light arrow, then it will just automatically curve if you shoot it straight.)
Every time that Ken is in the video, they usually start bickering like a couple and I love it.

Hey Felix! I'm a longtime fan but have never commented before. I just wanted to say that I miss the daily uploads, but I also appreciate your new content and your streaming. I hope you're settling well into your new place. Now that you're in asia, I highly recommend traveling to other nearby countries like South Korea and the Philippines if you haven't already. I'd really like to see a video in the future about your past traveling experiences and what other kinds of places you'd like to visit in the future. 
I appreciate what you do and what this community does for all the charitable actions and for positive attitudes. Lastly, thanks for being an idol with humility and patience, it goes a long way.

Here in The Netherlands we also have this type of algae all around our coastline. We call it “zeevonk” which is translated to sea sparkles and it’s super satisfying to watch it ;)

I think its really cute that pewds just likes hanging out with ken and making vids with him... every video is just cute of them chillin together. It doesnt seem like they are doing this for any other reason than to hang together :P

5:49  When the wind reaches the mountain it gets pushed up the mountain side, taking water vapor with it and forming a cloud above the peak.  This spot has some other unique things going on that allows this to happen but that's the gist of it.  A fun lecture in my meteorology class for sure.  Apparently that area gets quite a few UFO sighting reports because of this cloud.

We have some of that bioluminescence in the Pacific Northwest, it comes during a certain time of year but I don’t think it’s as strong as that. Ours is more green-teal, and it’s super cool when you stomp on the sand you get almost a small glowing shockwave.

The thing with the mountain I believe is called the cap cloud effect or something like that. Because mountains are basically giant obstacles for wind to have to over, the moisture that gets pushed up gets compressed and there fore condenses to form that cloud. I've heard the effect acts like a wave so sometimes similar looking clouds can be seen beyond the mountain, never seen that though.
